learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate the 	appropriate knowledge, skills and attitudes based on the Dietitians Australia National Competency Standards.
Consistently demonstrates the ability to critically reflect in collaboration with supervisors, peers and/or mentors.
Demonstrates the ability to communicate a range of concepts clearly and effectively to diverse audiences, including the ability to adapt key communication messages to a range of contexts.

assessments.due_date: Due Friday of the first week of the relevant Professional Practice 5 placement block by 5:00 pm.
assessments.task_description: With the Learning Plan, students will prepare for professional practice placement by reviewing previous feedback to develop a plan to continue to improve their skills, knowledge and competence to practice
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant ePortfolio submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Due Thursday one week following the relevant Professional Practice 5 placement block by 5:00pm. Refer to Blackboard for the specific due dates.
assessments.task_description: This task requires students to write a structured report about their Professional Practice project. In this written report students will demonstrate the appropriate knowledge, skills and attitudes based on the Dietitians Australia National Competency Standards through a professional practice project in the are of nutrition and dietetics.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
19/06/2025 9:00 am - 12:00 pm.

Refer to the Blackboard for more details.
assessments.task_description: Students are required to deliver a presentation about their professional practice project. In this presentation, students will demonstrate their ability to communicate effectively and showcase the development of knowledge, skills and attitudes based on the Dietitians Australia National Competency Standards to complete their professional practice project.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Practice Placement

Students must complete a total of 20 days of Professional Practice Placement during the semester. Students will complete their placement either in:

  • Block 1: Monday 10th of March to Friday 11th of April, or
  • Block 2: Monday 28th April to Friday 30th of May.

Each student will complete a personal learning plan in collaboration with university and professional staff.
